results.title: Three to go: Michael
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Gil Brealey and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Michael has to make decisions in the complex but permissive world of today. His friends have followed a relatively straight and narrow path of conformity. Michael has more or less taken this course, but knows that other ways exist. He is prepared to listen to the prophets of change and revolution and is taken on an excursion into the world of the young radical. In which world does Michael belong? Features Grahame Bond. Also available on DVD [319174].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Gil Brealey and Peter Weir

results.title: Three to go: Judy
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Brian Hannant and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Judy is a young girl who lives in a large provincial city. Like most girls of her age, she longs to get out and see life, to find the fun, romance and adventure. She wants to go to the big city to work. The film shows the last few weeks before she leaves home. We meet her parents, workmates and boy friend. In their comments we discover some of the problems a teenage girl has to face when living in a large country town.

results.title: Three teenagers
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, Southern California Consortium and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Time to grow”.
Presents case studies of three teenagers from vastly different backgrounds. It demonstrates how environment and family relationships shape their growth and development.

results.title: Three students
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. This film is about three adults who have undertaken adult education courses.

results.title: Three stories of agriculture in Mansfield
results.brief_description: Living on the land requires innovation and imagination these days. Three dynamic operators from the Mansfield Shire, in north-eastern Victoria, talk about the various challenges and rewards of working in the region. From the high-tech, computer controlled Murphy Fresh hydroponic tomato farm, to the glorious grounds of Kinloch Winery and the generations-old Delatite Station: these modern day “farmers” reflect on their great fortune at being able to run their operations in such a rich and diverse community.

results.title: Three steps to start
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan, Robert Betts and Francis Thompson
results.brief_description: Youthful vandalism prompts a small group of parents to call a meeting and to talk to city and school officials. They learn that there is no single answer to the problem; that there are many factors - home conditions, unemployment, lack of recreational facilities. One section of the town develops a young people’s centre which brings about community development of unified program.

results.title: Three shorts on architecture
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Sam Neill and David H. Fowler
results.brief_description: 1. “Some Elements of Architecture.” A no-commentary interlude of stone, wood and brick; patterns and colours, enclosed spaces, and people. 2. “Ways of Looking at Buildings.” Comments from assorted people upon high-rise and other buildings, old and new. 3. “Anxiety and Alternative.” Suggestions for new ways of preserving the uniqueness of our place, while building for our future. A comprehensive examination of New Zealand architecture - past, present and possible future.

results.title: Three score years and ten
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Pauline Shaw
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”
Looks at some of the positive aspects of old age, and what can be done by the ag ed, their families, and society at large, to make the final years pleasant and contented ones. Intended for children aged 13-16 years.

results.title: Three roads to tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Alan Orbiston and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: A story of the journey of three Nigerian students between their homes and Ibadan University. The three boys live far apart in the three regions of this vast country. The film is designed to show what Nigeria is like today and to illustrate the help which oil power (BP) is giving to the development of the country and its standard of living.
